feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 8:08PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN TUESDAY AFTERNOON AND WEDNESDAY... A quick moving but moist atmospheric river will move across the area starting Tuesday and persist into Wednesday evening. Streams and rivers will rise rapidly but at this time are expected to remain within their banks. Rain amounts will range from 1.5 to 3 inches with locally higher amounts possible. The heaviest precipitation

entry.summary: ...DENSE FOG IN SPOTS TONIGHT... Fog, dense in spot, is expected overnight, especially closer to Lake Superior from Grand Portage to Duluth, MN to Saxon Harbor, WI. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 2:02AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...AREAS OF FOG TONIGHT... Areas of fog, some dense, will be possible tonight into Monday morning. The visibility may drop to a quarter mile at times. If traveling, be prepared for changing visibility. Be ready to reduce your speed and increase your following distance. Ensure your headlights are on.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:45AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Areas of Dense Fog Developing Early This Morning... Areas of fog will continue to develop early this morning, especially in river valleys and low-lying areas.
